org.jamwiki.utils

Class ResourceUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamwiki.utils.ResourceUtil

  • public abstract class ResourceUtil
extends Object
    This class provides utilities for working with classpath resources such as property files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void forName(String className)
      This method is a wrapper for Class.forName that will attempt to load a class from both the current thread context class loader and the default class loader.
      static File getClassLoaderFile(String filename)
      Given a file name for a file that is located somewhere in the application classpath, return a File object representing the file.
      static File getClassLoaderRoot()
      Attempt to get the class loader root directory.
      static File getJAMWikiResourceFile(String filename)
      Retrieve a file from the JAMWiki system resources directory.
      static Object instantiateClass(String className)
      Given a String representation of a class name (for example, org.jamwiki.db.AnsiDataHandler) return an instance of the class.
      static String readFile(String filename)
      Utility method for reading a file from a classpath directory and returning its contents as a String.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceUtil

        public ResourceUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • forName

        public static void forName(String className)
                    throws ClassNotFoundException
        This method is a wrapper for Class.forName that will attempt to load a class from both the current thread context class loader and the default class loader.
        Parameters:
        className - The full class name that is to be initialized with the Class.forName call.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if the class cannot be initialized from any class loader.

      • getClassLoaderFile

        public static File getClassLoaderFile(String filename)
                               throws IOException
        Given a file name for a file that is located somewhere in the application classpath, return a File object representing the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file (relative to the classpath) that is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A file object representing the requested filename. Note that the file name is not guaranteed to match the filename passed to this method since (for example) the file might be found in a JAR file and thus will need to be copied to a temporary location for reading.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the classloader can not be found or if the file can not be found in the classpath.

      • getClassLoaderRoot

        public static File getClassLoaderRoot()
                               throws IOException
        Attempt to get the class loader root directory. This method works by searching for a file that MUST exist in the class loader root and then returning its parent directory.
        Returns:
        Returns a file indicating the directory of the class loader.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the class loader can not be found, which may occur if this class is deployed without the jamwiki-war package.

      • getJAMWikiResourceFile

        public static File getJAMWikiResourceFile(String filename)
                                   throws IOException
        Retrieve a file from the JAMWiki system resources directory. If the file does not exist then an attempt will be made to retrieve it from the classpath setup folder.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file (relative to the JAMWiki system resource directory) that is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        A file object representing the requested filename.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file can not be found in the JAMWiki system resources directory.

      • instantiateClass

        public static Object instantiateClass(String className)
        Given a String representation of a class name (for example, org.jamwiki.db.AnsiDataHandler) return an instance of the class. The constructor for the class being instantiated must not take any arguments.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class being instantiated.
        Returns:
        A Java Object representing an instance of the specified class.

      • readFile

        public static String readFile(String filename)
                       throws IOException
        Utility method for reading a file from a classpath directory and returning its contents as a String.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to be read, either as an absolute file path or relative to the classpath.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the file contents.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file cannot be found or if an I/O exception occurs.
